title: PropKa
description: Predict the pKa values of ionizable groups in proteins and protein-ligand complexes based in the 3D structure

reference.description: setting which reference to use for stability calculations.

chains.description: creating the protein with only a specified chain. Specify ' ' for chains without ID [all]

titrate_only.description: Treat only the specified residues as titratable. Value should be a comma-separated list of 'chain:resnum' values; for example: 'A:10,A:11'

thermophiles.description: defining a thermophile filename; usually used in 'alignment-mutations'

mutation.description: specifying mutation labels which are used to modify the input structure according to, e.g. N25R/N181D

ph.description: setting pH-value used in e.g. stability calculations

window.description: setting the pH-window to show e.g. stability profiles

grid.description: setting the pH-grid to calculate e.g. stability related properties

mutator.description: setting approach for mutating as filename

mutator_options.description: setting property for mutator e.g.: type=side-chain

display_coupled_residues.description: Displays alternative pKa values due to coupling of titratable groups

reuse_ligand_mol2_files.description: Reuses the ligand mol2 files allowing the user to alter ligand bond orders

protonate_all.description: Protonate all atoms (will not influence pKa calculation)
